options.optionText: Alright, Grace. Looks like you’re coming with me. Ready to go?
options.responseText: Wait, you’re... you’re taking me? Like, actually rescuing me? Is this a joke or... are you serious?

followUpOptions.optionText: Dead serious. Pack up your... well, you don’t have anything. Let’s just go.
followUpOptions.responseText: Wow, way to rub it in. But okay, yeah, I’m ready. I think. Do you... have a coat or something? It’s a little breezy in this, uh, situation.

followUpOptions.optionText: Not a joke, Grace. You’ve been through enough. Time to get you out of here.
followUpOptions.responseText: Thank you... I didn’t think anyone would actually come for me. I don’t even know what to say.

followUpOptions.optionText: Serious as a deathclaw in heat. Let’s move before Tina changes her mind.
followUpOptions.responseText: Ew, thanks for that mental image. But yeah, good idea. Let’s not stick around for round two.

options.optionText: So, what’s the story with your dad? Tina made him sound like a big deal.
options.responseText: My dad? Oh, um... yeah, he’s kind of a big deal. He runs Cumorah Crest—what’s left of it, anyway. He’s always been about power and bottle caps.

followUpOptions.optionText: Sounds like he’ll pay a lot to get you back.
followUpOptions.responseText: He will. But, uh, just a heads-up—he’s not exactly the warm and fuzzy type. Don’t expect hugs and thank-you speeches.

followUpOptions.optionText: Is he really gonna care? Tina made it sound like he might just be relieved you’re gone.
followUpOptions.responseText: Wow, harsh. But no, he’ll care. I mean, I think he will? I’m still technically his daughter, even if I’m not his favorite... or his second favorite... or... let’s just go.

followUpOptions.optionText: Do you even know how to survive out there?
followUpOptions.responseText: Um... no? I mean, I’ve read books. Does that count? I know not to drink out of glowing puddles, and I can sort of cook...

followUpOptions.optionText: Books, huh? Yeah, those will totally keep you alive. Stick close, rookie.
followUpOptions.responseText: Rookie? Okay, rude. But yeah, sticking close sounds like a solid plan right now.

followUpOptions.optionText: We’ll work on that. First lesson: don’t trust raiders.
followUpOptions.responseText: Lesson learned. Big time. Can we move on to 'how not to freeze to death in raider underwear' next?

options.optionText: Tina said you’re... well, a virgin. That true?
options.responseText: What?! Oh my God, she told you that? Why—why would she even say that?! That’s so weird!

followUpOptions.optionText: She thought it made you valuable. I’m guessing she’s not wrong.
followUpOptions.responseText: Great. So I’m just a walking unopened box in Raiderland now? Cool. Love that for me.

followUpOptions.optionText: Relax. I don’t care. Just making sure she wasn’t exaggerating.
followUpOptions.responseText: Oh, well, uh, yeah... no exaggeration. I didn’t exactly have a lot of... opportunities at the Crest.

options.optionText: What’s your name? You got a story?
options.responseText: Oh, um, it’s Grace. Grace Wells. I used to live somewhere called Cumorah Crest. It was... different from all this. Then they came. The raiders. And now, I guess, here I am.

followUpOptions.responseText: It was. Too fancy, maybe. My dad thought walls and caps could protect us. Turns out, he was wrong.

followUpOptions.optionText: Sorry you had to go through that. The wasteland’s brutal.
followUpOptions.responseText: Thanks. I don’t think I’ve really processed it yet. Everything’s just... gone.
